definition[0]: to get rid of something that you do not want by giving it or selling it to someone else
example[0]: The dealer had offloaded some of the shares onto a willing client.
definition[1]: to take something off a truck or ship
definition[2]: to get rid of something you do not want by giving or selling it to someone
example[2]: Most high street chains managed to offload last season’s stock by offering discounts of up to 50%.
example[3]: A dealer offloaded 5,000 of the shares onto a client.
definition[3]: to take goods off a truck or ship
example[4]: Dockers were offloading the ship’s cargo.
